title: Hand drawn fine script capitals in IKEA PS advertisement
content:
This is not exactly my area of expertise. Does anybody recognise these hand drawn capitals (“The IKEA PS Design Neverending Story”) before I start searching myself? It _does_ look vaguely familiar. Oh, and it is a font — identical characters look identical; they’ve just been scaled.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090505173731im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Ikea-poster_6028.jpg)
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content:
Are you sure this is a font Yves? Those E arms don’t all meet the stems the same way. I think they repeated “STORY”, but other places the letters seem to vary. I searched Part 12 and 14 of the Script Guide, and didn’t find a match, but some of the [FF Child’s Play](http://web.archive.org/web/20090505173731/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-childs-play/) fonts were similar. Stuart’s Spaghetti Western (FontDiner)had similar shapes, but with serifs.

- Mike Yanega

The initials of AOE’s [Swimsuit Boys](http://web.archive.org/web/20090505173731/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=ASOE-SWBO) are fairly similar too, but I still think this might be custom/hand-drawn.

- Mike Yanega

There are identical characters, but of course they could’ve been copy-pasted. :^/

I don’t know anymore.
The one I posted is not a font, btw. It’s just a lot of vectors packed in a zip. Quite a bit of alternates in there as well.
